isis.stitle: Recall 96505 - 3600, 3800 and 3900FC Bus with Air Brakes and Antilock Brake Systems

recall.subject: 3600, 3800 and 3900FC Bus with Air Brakes and Antilock Brake Systems

defect.para: This Recall applies to 3600, 3800 and 3900FC model buses built 01/30/1992 through 09/06/1996 with air brakes and antilock brake system, code 04AZA.

The antilock brake wiring may have been connected wrong during the assembly process. The wiring from the electronic control unit (ECU) may have been connected to the wrong wheel sensor and/or the wiring from the ECU may have been connected to the wrong brake modulator valve. Should the ABS wiring be crossed, it would result in a significant degradation in braking stability. A signal would be sent to the wrong brake chamber when a brake imbalance is detected. This defect could cause a vehicular accident without warning which could result in personal injury or property damage, or both.

Owners will be notified of this campaign on their vehicles by Navistar. A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Each bus must have the following functional check to determine if the antilock brake system wiring is connected properly.

step1.para: Check ECU window displays and clear faults by placing a magnet against RESET and then removing magnet.

note.para: It may be necessary to remove the paint mask on the ECU window. Also for easier visibility of window displays, rub black grease across recessed letters in ECU windows.

step1.para: Unplug left rear sensor wires. Three red LEDs - RER, LFT and SEN should light up. If these three LEDs light up then the rear sensors are connected correctly. If RHT lights up instead of LFT then the sensor wires are reversed and must be switched.

Unplug wires at left rear modulator. Three red LEDs - RER, LFT and MOD should light up. If these three LEDs light up then the rear modulators are connected correctly. If RHT lights up instead of LFT then the modulator wires are reversed and must be switched.

Unplug left front sensor wires. Three red LEDs - FRT, LFT and SEN should light up. If these three LEDs light up then the front sensors are connected correctly. If RHT lights up instead of LFT then the sensor wires are reversed and must be switched.

Unplug wires at left front modulator. Three red LEDs - FRT, LFT and MOD should light up. If these three LEDs light up then the front modulators are connected correctly. If RHT lights up instead of LFT then the modulator wires are reversed and must be switched.
If any other diagnostics of the ABS system are required, refer to CTS-5252.

partsinfo.para: None required to perform this inspection and repair.

entry.para: Functionally check ABS system wiring and reverse connections as required.

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward. The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair the vehicle as soon as possible.
